title: üèß ATM System ‚Äî Low Level Design (LLD)
subtitle: Production-Grade ATM Architecture for LLD & Interviews
description: Design-focused, production-style ATM machine system modelling complete transaction lifecycle with safe orchestration and hardware abstraction.
overview: Models the full lifecycle of ATM transactions: card & PIN validation, transaction routing, chain-based handler execution, bank integration, cash planning and dispensing, receipt generation, logging, and rollback-safe completion ‚Äî all with clear separation of orchestration and business logic.
features: End-to-end ATM transaction lifecycle (Withdraw, Deposit, Balance Enquiry)
Chain of Responsibility for validations and updates
Context-driven execution with a single AtmContext object
Extensible design for new transaction types and rules

patterns.name: Strategy
patterns.usage: Switching between Withdraw, Deposit and Balance Enquiry flows

patterns.name: Chain of Responsibility
patterns.usage: Handler chains for validation, updates and receipts

patterns.name: Factory
patterns.usage: Transaction strategy and handler chain creation

patterns.name: Repository
patterns.usage: Persistence layer for banking and journaling

title: Parking Management System
subtitle: Low-Level Design Implementation
description: A clean object-oriented implementation of a parking lot system.
overview: Models real-world parking behavior: entry, slot allocation, ticketing, exit, pricing, payment, and slot release with well-defined boundaries.
features: Dynamic fee calculation (rain fee, surge fee)
